void SingleBlock::mousePressEvent ( QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent *  event  ) 

Added by Manpreet Kohli defines what happens when the user clicks on blocks in the level editor

Definition at line 56 of file block.cpp.

00057 {
00058     if (Constants::levelNumber == 0)
00059     {
00060         // if the block clicked on is inside the small items window on the right hand side
00061         if (this->scene()->width() < Constants::itemsWindowViewWidth)
00062         {
00063             colorSelected = this->color2;
00064             this->scene()->removeItem(Constants::currentBlock);

00068             switch(colorSelected)

00094             this->scene()->addItem(Constants::currentBlock);
00095             Constants::currentBlock->setXPos(-274);
00096             Constants::currentBlock->setYPos(-225);
00097             Constants::currentBlock->setPos(-274, -225);
00098         }
00099 
00100         // if the block selected was inside the main view window
00101         else
00102         {
00103             if (colorSelected == 7)
00104                 this->setColor1(7);
00105             else
00106                 this->setColor1(1);
00107 
00108             // if the block clicked on was not transparent, remove the previous selection of the block
00109             // from the two vectors
00110             if (this->getColor2() != 7)
00111             {
00112                 int tempIndex = Constants::positions.indexOf(this->scenePos());
00113                 Constants::positions.remove(tempIndex);
00114                 Constants::colors.remove(tempIndex);
00115             }
00116 
00117             this->setOpacity(2.0);
00118             this->setColor2(colorSelected);
00119 
00120             // if a transparent block was not clicked, push the new block position and color into 
00121             // the two vectors
00122             if (colorSelected != 7)
00123             {
00124                 Constants::positions.push_back(this->scenePos());
00125                 Constants::colors.push_back(this->getColor2());
00126             }
00127 
00128             // update the blocks
00129             update(this->boundingRect());
00130             update(this->sceneBoundingRect());
00131         }
00132     }
